title: Valerian et Laureline - Complete in French, Spanish and all rele
description:
Hi all,


Today I thought I'd share a truly fantastic Valerian et Laureline collection that I snagged from Demonoid a few months before it went down. I haven't seen any decent V&L torrents since encountering this one, so I've decided to try to give something back by re-uploading it. 

This is one of my favourite French comics--science fiction art way ahead of its time (George Lucas took a lot from this comic for Star Wars), fantastic adventures, and the perfect duo in Valerian and Laureline (and such a sweet, slow, natural romance between the two). It was written by Pierre Christin and illustrated by Jean-Claude Mezieres. To my French- and/or Spanish-speaking friends: Enjoy! To my English compatriotes: At least you have the New Future trilogy (I think something like 1-8 of the comic may also have been issued in English at some point, but I don't have those scans). 


First, from wikipedia:

ValÃƒÂ©rian and Laureline (French: ValÃƒÂ©rian et Laureline), also known as ValÃƒÂ©rian: Spatio-Temporal Agent (French: ValÃƒÂ©rian: Agent Spatio-Temporel) or just ValÃƒÂ©rian, is a French science fiction comics series, created by writer Pierre Christin and artist Jean-Claude MÃƒÂ©ziÃƒÂ¨res. First published in the magazine Pilote in 1967, the final installment was published in 2010. All of the ValÃƒÂ©rian stories have been collected in graphic novel album format, comprising some twenty-one volumes plus a short story collection and an encyclopaedia. ValÃƒÂ©rian is one of the top five biggest selling Franco-Belgian comics titles of its publisher, Dargaud.[1]
The series focuses on the adventures of the dark-haired ValÃƒÂ©rian, a spatio-temporal agent, and his redheaded female companion, Laureline, as they travel the universe through space and time. ValÃƒÂ©rian is a classical anti-hero, kind-hearted, strong and brave but with a tendency to follow the orders of his superiors even if he feels, deep down, that it is the wrong thing to do. On the other hand, his companion Laureline combines her superior intelligence, determination and independence with sex-appeal, making her one of science fiction's most notable heroines. Influenced by classic literary science fiction, the series mixes space opera with time travel plots. Christin's scripts are noted for their humour, complexity and strongly humanist and left-wing liberal political ideas while MÃƒÂ©ziÃƒÂ¨res' art is characterised by its vivid depictions of the alien worlds and species ValÃƒÂ©rian and Laureline encounter on their adventures. The series was a landmark in European comics and pop culture, and influenced other media as well - traces of its concepts, storylines and designs can be found on sci-fi films such as Star Wars, The Fifth Element, and Avatar.
Many of the stories have been translated into several languages, including English.[2] The series has received recognition through a number of prestigious awards, including the Grand Prix de la ville d'AngoulÃƒÂªme. An animated television series, Time Jam: Valerian & Laureline, was released in 2007.

This collection includes:

- Every volume of the comic in both French and Spanish (including Les Mauvais Reves)
- The English translation of the New Future Trilogy
- Both volumes of the "Les Habitants du Ciel" cosmic atlas, exploring the world of Valerian et Laureline
- The short story collection Par les Chemins de l'Espace
- The short stories Le Grand Collectioneur and Droles de Specimen
